remarks.para: May be inoperative provided operation of the associated system is verified once each flight day.

placard.para: Placard Stall Test switch (P61) "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Check that trailing edge flaps and leading edge slats are fully retracted with flap lever in zero (flaps up) detent.
Provide electrical power (Ref. Maintenance Manual 24-22-00).

warning.para: KEEP PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT CLEAR OF ALL CONTROL SURFACES TO PREVENT INJURY OR DAMAGE.

numlitem.para: Open RAT AUTO CONT C/B (11D26).
Pressurize left hydraulic system (Ref. Maintenance Manual 29-11-00).
Position flap lever to 1-unit detent, check that flaps move to 1 (one) and slats move to the intermediate (takeoff) position.
Check that left and right angle-of-attack vanes are parallel to ground.
Provide a pressure source to pressurize upper left and upper right pitot-static probes to 140-150 knots (0.47 - 0.54 psig) regulated air pressure (Ref. Maintenance Manual 34-11-00).
Check that left stall warning/autoslat system is operational:
Open L AOA PROBE HT (6L17) and Air/Ground relay system No. 1 (11S15) circuit breakers.
Check that left AOA vane is cool enough to touch. If not, wait until vane cools.
Rotate left AOA vane counterclockwise (vane trailing edge up) approximately 20 degrees and check that left stickshaker shakes control columns and that slats deploy.
Rotate left AOA vane to original position and check that left stickshaker stops shaking and slats return to sealed position.
Close L AOA PROBE HT (6L17) and Air/Ground relay system No. 1 (11S15) circuit breakers.
Check that right stall warning/autoslat system is operational:
Open R AOA PROBE HT (6L23) and Air/Ground relay system No. 2 (11S19) circuit breakers.
Check that right AOA vane is cool enough to touch. If not, wait until vane cools.
Rotate right AOA vane clockwise (vane trailing edge up) approximately 20 degrees and check that right stickshaker shakes control columns and that slats deploy.
Rotate right AOA vane to original position and check that right stickshaker stops shaking, and slats return to sealed position.
Close R AOA PROBE HT (6L23) and Air/Ground relay system No. 2 (11S19) circuit breakers.
Restore aircraft to normal.
Close RAT AUTO CONT C/B (11D26).
